content: Kind of random, but I was recalling an old text about the modula-3 language, https://www2.cs.arizona.edu/~collberg/Teaching/520/2005/Html/Html-27/#SECTION02010000000000000000 where rather than issues being shown from a specific characters perspective, there is a sort of dialog between characters, I figured it was worth mentioning, in cases where there isn't a clear cut choice between which character best represents the target audience of a specific story... not sure if this has come up in practice though.
we did have some stories where one character goes to another for help, that sort of thing
